de.esoco.lib.model

Class ListDataModel<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.model.ListDataModel<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataModel<T>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<T>

    public class ListDataModel<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataModel<T>, java.io.Serializable
    A simple data model implementation that is based on a list. A name can be assigned to instances so that they can be rendered directly in certain user interface elements.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ListDataModel(java.lang.String sName, java.util.List<T> rData)
      Creates a new instance from a list of data.
      ListDataModel(java.lang.String sName, T... rElements)
      Creates a new instance that contains the given elements.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListDataModel

        public ListDataModel(java.lang.String sName,
                     java.util.List<T> rData)
        Creates a new instance from a list of data. The list will be used directly (i.e. without copying their contents) so that changes to the list data will modify the model too. If this is not desired a copy of the original list should be used as the argument instead.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of this model
        rData - The model's data

      • ListDataModel

        @SafeVarargs
public ListDataModel(java.lang.String sName,
                                   T... rElements)
        Creates a new instance that contains the given elements.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of this model
        rElements - The elements this data model shall contain

      • getElement

        public T getElement(int nIndex)
        Description copied from interface: DataModel
        Returns the data element at a certain position. The position index must be in the range from 0 (zero) to DataModel.getElementCount() - 1, else an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        getElement in interface DataModel<T>
        Parameters:
        nIndex - The position of the element to return
        Returns:
        The data element at the given position
        See Also:
        DataModel.getElement(int)

        Specified by:

      • setData

        protected void setData(java.util.List<T> rData)
        A method for subclasses to set the data of this model. This method should be used by subclasses that need to initialize the model data after the model instance has been created.
        Parameters:
        rData - The model data
